reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2017
reviews.reviewText: My daughter loves this pacifier. It foes have a smell but it's the nature of rubber. It's a whole soft piece so my teething daughter chews it and uses it as a soothie. Sometimes she drops it when she sleeps and put her cheek on it but since it's soft, it doesn't hurt her like other pacifiers.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2017
reviews.reviewText: Love these! The only pacifiers my baby will use. How couldn't you love these, they're natural and chemical free. Comforting, especially since it's constantly being used. I only wish they were around when I had my daughter 5 years ago who loved a pacifier. Easy to clean! I have 6 of them that get rotated and I have yet to see any wear.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love! So Beyond Worth it! Get These N.O.W!
reviews.reviewText: LOVE these. Everyone comments on how big they seem but I love that the base part is so big, it touches my daughters nose lightly and soothes her more because I think it makes her feel like when she’s breastfeeding. They wash easy, they’re durable. They’re natural. They’re only one piece so there’s nothing to choke on. I can’t say enough great things about these.Also*** I absolutely love that the entire thing is soft and rubber because I put my daughter to sleep with these and she drops it halfway through the night and ends up laying on it most of the time, but because the entire thing is soft it doesn’t bug or hurt her at all. Mega score.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I was searching for a pacifier like Natursutten that didn't cost a crazy amount of money
reviews.reviewText: I was searching for a pacifier like Natursutten that didn't cost a crazy amount of money. I loved that these come in a pack of three for under 20$ - safe natural pacifiers should not have to be a luxury item - it also made me happy to read that they are made from a single mold so it is unlikely that pieces will just break off in babies mouth. It is interesting to hear about the trees they are made from if you are ever interested in looking it up. I also was worried about the smell but it is not at all as strong as some reviewers make it seem and smells to me almost medical. The pacifier is soft and flexible and I was happy for the orthodontic shape for baby's mouth. So far I'm impressed!Edit- as a newborn baby didn't like these. It took a week or two in soothers before we transitioned to these pacifiers. They seem to stay in his mouth better than the soothers now so we use them interchangeably. Also the rubber smell has seriously diminished in the few short weeks we have been using them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Brim covers baby's nose and rubber is thinner than other brands
reviews.reviewText: The brim of this covered my baby's nose, so baby didn't like it. The nipple size was a bit larger than other brands of rubber pacifiers I've tried. The rubber was definitely thinner than other brands I've tried, but the price of these was 3 for the price of 1 of the more expensive brands. My kids won't use the rubber ones, so I opted for BPA free from NUK and Avent, with silicone orthodontic nipples. Rubber is supposedly healthier though, if your baby will take it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is a wonderful pacifier. MY DOUGHTER LOVES IT
reviews.reviewText: This is a wonderful pacifier .MY DOUGHTER LOVES IT. Natural and free of all toxic artificial stuff. I keep these ones at home and have other BPA free spare ones in her diaper bag. they are pricy but I wont give my child anything else specially for nap and a good night sleep. bough another set for my baby on the way too :)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2017
reviews.reviewText: I highly recommend these rubber pacifiers. I used similar ones for my own babies many decades ago, and I never had to worry about the hard plastic rim of regular pacifiers digging into their heads or faces while they slept on them. I still have one of the pacifiers from that time (no longer usable, rubber does age after all :) ) but it is a fun memory, and now I am getting same style for grand kids. These look just as good and sturdy as the ones from long ago.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Inferior Qualify, Breaks down quickly when instructions are followed to disinfect regularly
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this product because I needed a pacifier quickly and the brand (Natursutten) I had been using for my baby would not ship as quickly. I also was drawn to the 3 pack option as the other brand only shipped single packaged pacifiers.Both pacifiers claimed to be natural rubber and BPA free. Both pacifiers gave instructions to boil the pacifier before using it and replacing the pacifier around 6-8 weeks as the rubber will start to break down.Some differences I noticed immediately upon opening the package...Thr Eco brand pacifier’s rubber appeared darker in color and the orthodontic tip was larger than the previous brand. Eco brand was to be boiled for 5 minutes before initial use. This pacifier’s design has an opening from the handle side into the orthodontic tip which allows air/water/spit up/etc. in; the other brand was sealed off. The Eco brand’s handle is more substantial and rigid.Although there were slight differences in size, my baby took to the Eco brand just fine. I appreciated the rigid handle because if the pacifier fell out in the middle of the night in the dark, it was much easier to distinguish which side was “up” without having to use a light source. Sometimes those few precious seconds make all the difference when calming a fussy baby.My baby used the pacifier regularly throughout the day, between feedings to help with acid reflux, when not talking or playing, and sometimes while sleeping. I rinsed the pacifier regularly throughout the day and boiled per instructions on an (almost) daily basis to disinfect. After about a week, I noticed after disinfecting the pacifier that my baby was not taking the pacifier as quickly as before. I inspected it and noticed that it smelled strongly of burnt rubber. As I had just boiled the pacifier, I tried running it under water with the thought that it must still be slightly warm and that was creating the smell. When rinsing with cold water did not help, I inspected the pacifier further. I put it in my mouth and sucked it like my baby would. There was a definite rubber taste. So I tossed that one and prepared the second pacifier in my Eco brand 3 pack. Initially it smelled fine and my baby took it without trouble. However, just as with the first pacifier, this second one began smelling strongly of burnt rubber and developed a bad taste after disinfecting via the package instructions to boil in water, and my baby would not take it.This brand appears to be inferior quality, emitting a bad smell and taste, possibly leaving a film in the mouth as it breaks down over short period of time following regular disinfectant instructions. I threw away the third pacifier in the pack and reordered the brand I had initially purchased. Although this pacifier had some nice features, I would not recommend it.
